Aarshvi Gajjar

I am first year Ph.D. student of computer science at the Algorithms and Foundations Group of NYU's Tandon School of Engineering. Here, I am fortunate to be co-advised by Professors Christopher Musco and Chinmay Hegde. Prior to this I received my masters from UMass Amherst in 2021, where I worked with Professor Cameron Musco.

I am interested in studying the mathematical foundations of machine learning, specifically in approximation theory, randomized sampling, high dimensional geometry with applications to scientific computing and compressed sensing.

Course Assistant

Algorithmic Machine Learning and Data Science: Spring 2022 and Fall 2021.
